00072 void game_copy_pose(bPose **dst, bPose *src, int copy_constraint)
00073 {
00074     bPose *out;
00075     bPoseChannel *pchan, *outpchan;
00076     GHash *ghash;
00077     
00078     /* the game engine copies the current armature pose and then swaps
00079      * the object pose pointer. this makes it possible to change poses
00080      * without affecting the original blender data. */
00081 
00082     if (!src) {
00083         *dst=NULL;
00084         return;
00085     }
00086     else if (*dst==src) {
00087         printf("copy_pose source and target are the same\n");
00088         *dst=NULL;
00089         return;
00090     }
00091     
00092     out= (bPose*)MEM_dupallocN(src);
00093     out->chanhash = NULL;
00094     out->agroups.first= out->agroups.last= NULL;
00095     out->ikdata = NULL;
00096     out->ikparam = MEM_dupallocN(out->ikparam);
00097     out->flag |= POSE_GAME_ENGINE;
00098     BLI_duplicatelist(&out->chanbase, &src->chanbase);
00099 
00100     /* remap pointers */
00101     ghash= BLI_ghash_new(BLI_ghashutil_ptrhash, BLI_ghashutil_ptrcmp, "game_copy_pose gh");
00102 
00103     pchan= (bPoseChannel*)src->chanbase.first;
00104     outpchan= (bPoseChannel*)out->chanbase.first;
00105     for (; pchan; pchan=pchan->next, outpchan=outpchan->next)
00106         BLI_ghash_insert(ghash, pchan, outpchan);
00107 
00108     for (pchan=(bPoseChannel*)out->chanbase.first; pchan; pchan=(bPoseChannel*)pchan->next) {
00109         pchan->parent= (bPoseChannel*)BLI_ghash_lookup(ghash, pchan->parent);
00110         pchan->child= (bPoseChannel*)BLI_ghash_lookup(ghash, pchan->child);
00111 
00112         if (copy_constraint) {
00113             ListBase listb;
00114             // copy all constraint for backward compatibility
00115             copy_constraints(&listb, &pchan->constraints, FALSE);  // copy_constraints NULLs listb, no need to make extern for this operation.
00116             pchan->constraints= listb;
00117         } else {
00118             pchan->constraints.first = NULL;
00119             pchan->constraints.last = NULL;
00120         }
00121 
00122         // fails to link, props are not used in the BGE yet.
00123 #if 0
00124         if (pchan->prop)
00125             pchan->prop= IDP_CopyProperty(pchan->prop);
00126 #endif
00127         pchan->prop= NULL;
00128     }
00129 
00130     BLI_ghash_free(ghash, NULL, NULL);
00131     // set acceleration structure for channel lookup
00132     make_pose_channels_hash(out);
00133     *dst=out;
00134 }

00137 
00138 /* Only allowed for Poses with identical channels */
00139 void game_blend_poses(bPose *dst, bPose *src, float srcweight/*, short mode*/)
00140 {
00141     short mode= ACTSTRIPMODE_BLEND;
00142     
00143     bPoseChannel *dchan;
00144     const bPoseChannel *schan;
00145     bConstraint *dcon, *scon;
00146     float dstweight;
00147     int i;
00148 
00149     switch (mode) {
00150     case ACTSTRIPMODE_BLEND:
00151         dstweight = 1.0F - srcweight;
00152         break;
00153     case ACTSTRIPMODE_ADD:
00154         dstweight = 1.0F;
00155         break;
00156     default :
00157         dstweight = 1.0F;
00158     }
00159     
00160     schan= (bPoseChannel*)src->chanbase.first;
00161     for (dchan = (bPoseChannel*)dst->chanbase.first; dchan; dchan=(bPoseChannel*)dchan->next, schan= (bPoseChannel*)schan->next) {
00162         // always blend on all channels since we don't know which one has been set
00163         /* quat interpolation done separate */
00164         if (schan->rotmode == ROT_MODE_QUAT) {
00165             float dquat[4], squat[4];
00166             
00167             copy_qt_qt(dquat, dchan->quat);
00168             copy_qt_qt(squat, schan->quat);
00169             if (mode==ACTSTRIPMODE_BLEND)
00170                 interp_qt_qtqt(dchan->quat, dquat, squat, srcweight);
00171             else {
00172                 mul_fac_qt_fl(squat, srcweight);
00173                 mul_qt_qtqt(dchan->quat, dquat, squat);
00174             }
00175             
00176             normalize_qt(dchan->quat);
00177         }
00178 
00179         for (i=0; i<3; i++) {
00180             /* blending for loc and scale are pretty self-explanatory... */
00181             dchan->loc[i] = (dchan->loc[i]*dstweight) + (schan->loc[i]*srcweight);
00182             dchan->size[i] = 1.0f + ((dchan->size[i]-1.0f)*dstweight) + ((schan->size[i]-1.0f)*srcweight);
00183             
00184             /* euler-rotation interpolation done here instead... */
00185             // FIXME: are these results decent?
00186             if (schan->rotmode)
00187                 dchan->eul[i] = (dchan->eul[i]*dstweight) + (schan->eul[i]*srcweight);
00188         }
00189         for (dcon= (bConstraint*)dchan->constraints.first, scon= (bConstraint*)schan->constraints.first; dcon && scon; dcon= (bConstraint*)dcon->next, scon= (bConstraint*)scon->next) {
00190             /* no 'add' option for constraint blending */
00191             dcon->enforce= dcon->enforce*(1.0f-srcweight) + scon->enforce*srcweight;
00192         }
00193     }
00194     
00195     /* this pose is now in src time */
00196     dst->ctime= src->ctime;
00197 }
00198 
00199 void game_free_pose(bPose *pose)
00200 {
00201     if (pose) {
00202         /* free pose-channels and constraints */
00203         free_pose_channels(pose);
00204         
00205         /* free IK solver state */
00206         BIK_clear_data(pose);
00207 
00208         /* free IK solver param */
00209         if (pose->ikparam)
00210             MEM_freeN(pose->ikparam);
00211 
00212         MEM_freeN(pose);
00213     }
00214 }

00216 BL_ArmatureObject::BL_ArmatureObject(
00217                 void* sgReplicationInfo, 
00218                 SG_Callbacks callbacks, 
00219                 Object *armature,
00220                 Scene *scene,
00221                 int vert_deform_type)
00222 
00223 :   KX_GameObject(sgReplicationInfo,callbacks),
00224     m_controlledConstraints(),
00225     m_poseChannels(),
00226     m_objArma(armature),
00227     m_framePose(NULL),
00228     m_scene(scene), // maybe remove later. needed for where_is_pose
00229     m_lastframe(0.0),
00230     m_timestep(0.040),
00231     m_activeAct(NULL),
00232     m_activePriority(999),
00233     m_vert_deform_type(vert_deform_type),
00234     m_constraintNumber(0),
00235     m_channelNumber(0),
00236     m_lastapplyframe(0.0)
00237 {
00238     m_armature = (bArmature *)armature->data;
00239 
00240     /* we make a copy of blender object's pose, and then always swap it with
00241      * the original pose before calling into blender functions, to deal with
00242      * replica's or other objects using the same blender object */
00243     m_pose = NULL;
00244     game_copy_pose(&m_pose, m_objArma->pose, 1);
00245     // store the original armature object matrix
00246     memcpy(m_obmat, m_objArma->obmat, sizeof(m_obmat));
00247 }
00248 
00249 BL_ArmatureObject::~BL_ArmatureObject()
00250 {
00251     BL_ArmatureConstraint* constraint;
00252     while ((constraint = m_controlledConstraints.Remove()) != NULL) {
00253         delete constraint;
00254     }
00255     BL_ArmatureChannel* channel;
00256     while ((channel = static_cast<BL_ArmatureChannel*>(m_poseChannels.Remove())) != NULL) {
00257         delete channel;
00258     }
00259     if (m_pose)
00260         game_free_pose(m_pose);
00261     if (m_framePose)
00262         game_free_pose(m_framePose);
00263 }
00264 
00265 
00266 void BL_ArmatureObject::LoadConstraints(KX_BlenderSceneConverter* converter)
00267 {
00268     // first delete any existing constraint (should not have any)
00269     while (!m_controlledConstraints.Empty()) {
00270         BL_ArmatureConstraint* constraint = m_controlledConstraints.Remove();
00271         delete constraint;
00272     }
00273     m_constraintNumber = 0;
00274 
00275     // list all the constraint and convert them to BL_ArmatureConstraint
00276     // get the persistent pose structure
00277     bPoseChannel* pchan;
00278     bConstraint* pcon;
00279     bConstraintTypeInfo* cti;
00280     Object* blendtarget;
00281     KX_GameObject* gametarget;
00282     KX_GameObject* gamesubtarget;
00283 
00284     // and locate the constraint
00285     for (pchan = (bPoseChannel*)m_pose->chanbase.first; pchan; pchan=(bPoseChannel*)pchan->next) {
00286         for (pcon = (bConstraint*)pchan->constraints.first; pcon; pcon=(bConstraint*)pcon->next) {
00287             if (pcon->flag & CONSTRAINT_DISABLE)
00288                 continue;
00289             // which constraint should we support?
00290             switch (pcon->type) {
00291             case CONSTRAINT_TYPE_TRACKTO:
00292             case CONSTRAINT_TYPE_DAMPTRACK:
00293             case CONSTRAINT_TYPE_KINEMATIC:
00294             case CONSTRAINT_TYPE_ROTLIKE:
00295             case CONSTRAINT_TYPE_LOCLIKE:
00296             case CONSTRAINT_TYPE_MINMAX:
00297             case CONSTRAINT_TYPE_SIZELIKE:
00298             case CONSTRAINT_TYPE_LOCKTRACK:
00299             case CONSTRAINT_TYPE_STRETCHTO:
00300             case CONSTRAINT_TYPE_CLAMPTO:
00301             case CONSTRAINT_TYPE_TRANSFORM:
00302             case CONSTRAINT_TYPE_DISTLIMIT:
00303             case CONSTRAINT_TYPE_TRANSLIKE:
00304                 cti = constraint_get_typeinfo(pcon);
00305                 gametarget = gamesubtarget = NULL;
00306                 if (cti && cti->get_constraint_targets) {
00307                     ListBase listb = { NULL, NULL };
00308                     cti->get_constraint_targets(pcon, &listb);
00309                     if (listb.first) {
00310                         bConstraintTarget* target = (bConstraintTarget*)listb.first;
00311                         if (target->tar && target->tar != m_objArma) {
00312                             // only remember external objects, self target is handled automatically
00313                             blendtarget = target->tar;
00314                             gametarget = converter->FindGameObject(blendtarget);
00315                         }
00316                         if (target->next != NULL) {
00317                             // secondary target
00318                             target = (bConstraintTarget*)target->next;
00319                             if (target->tar && target->tar != m_objArma) {
00320                                 // only track external object
00321                                 blendtarget = target->tar;
00322                                 gamesubtarget = converter->FindGameObject(blendtarget);
00323                             }
00324                         }
00325                     }
00326                     if (cti->flush_constraint_targets)
00327                         cti->flush_constraint_targets(pcon, &listb, 1);
00328                 }
00329                 BL_ArmatureConstraint* constraint = new BL_ArmatureConstraint(this, pchan, pcon, gametarget, gamesubtarget);
00330                 m_controlledConstraints.AddBack(constraint);
00331                 m_constraintNumber++;
00332             }
00333         }
00334     }
00335 }
00336 
00337 BL_ArmatureConstraint* BL_ArmatureObject::GetConstraint(const char* posechannel, const char* constraintname)
00338 {
00339     SG_DList::iterator<BL_ArmatureConstraint> cit(m_controlledConstraints);
00340     for (cit.begin(); !cit.end(); ++cit) {
00341         BL_ArmatureConstraint* constraint = *cit;
00342         if (constraint->Match(posechannel, constraintname))
00343             return constraint;
00344     }
00345     return NULL;
00346 }
00347 
00348 BL_ArmatureConstraint* BL_ArmatureObject::GetConstraint(const char* posechannelconstraint)
00349 {
00350     // performance: use hash string instead of plain string compare
00351     SG_DList::iterator<BL_ArmatureConstraint> cit(m_controlledConstraints);
00352     for (cit.begin(); !cit.end(); ++cit) {
00353         BL_ArmatureConstraint* constraint = *cit;
00354         if (!strcmp(constraint->GetName(), posechannelconstraint))
00355             return constraint;
00356     }
00357     return NULL;
00358 }

00360 BL_ArmatureConstraint* BL_ArmatureObject::GetConstraint(int index)
00361 {
00362     SG_DList::iterator<BL_ArmatureConstraint> cit(m_controlledConstraints);
00363     for (cit.begin(); !cit.end() && index; ++cit, --index);
00364     return (cit.end()) ? NULL : *cit;
00365 }

00367 /* this function is called to populate the m_poseChannels list */
00368 void BL_ArmatureObject::LoadChannels()
00369 {
00370     if (m_poseChannels.Empty()) {
00371         bPoseChannel* pchan;
00372         BL_ArmatureChannel* proxy;
00373     
00374         m_channelNumber = 0;
00375         for (pchan = (bPoseChannel*)m_pose->chanbase.first; pchan; pchan=(bPoseChannel*)pchan->next) {
00376             proxy = new BL_ArmatureChannel(this, pchan);
00377             m_poseChannels.AddBack(proxy);
00378             m_channelNumber++;
00379         }
00380     }
00381 }
00382 
00383 BL_ArmatureChannel* BL_ArmatureObject::GetChannel(bPoseChannel* pchan)
00384 {
00385     LoadChannels();
00386     SG_DList::iterator<BL_ArmatureChannel> cit(m_poseChannels);
00387     for (cit.begin(); !cit.end(); ++cit) 
00388     {
00389         BL_ArmatureChannel* channel = *cit;
00390         if (channel->m_posechannel == pchan)
00391             return channel;
00392     }
00393     return NULL;
00394 }
00395 
00396 BL_ArmatureChannel* BL_ArmatureObject::GetChannel(const char* str)
00397 {
00398     LoadChannels();
00399     SG_DList::iterator<BL_ArmatureChannel> cit(m_poseChannels);
00400     for (cit.begin(); !cit.end(); ++cit) 
00401     {
00402         BL_ArmatureChannel* channel = *cit;
00403         if (!strcmp(channel->m_posechannel->name, str))
00404             return channel;
00405     }
00406     return NULL;
00407 }
00408 
00409 BL_ArmatureChannel* BL_ArmatureObject::GetChannel(int index)
00410 {
00411     LoadChannels();
00412     if (index < 0 || index >= m_channelNumber)
00413         return NULL;
00414     SG_DList::iterator<BL_ArmatureChannel> cit(m_poseChannels);
00415     for (cit.begin(); !cit.end() && index; ++cit, --index);
00416     return (cit.end()) ? NULL : *cit;
00417 }

00419 CValue* BL_ArmatureObject::GetReplica()
00420 {
00421     BL_ArmatureObject* replica = new BL_ArmatureObject(*this);
00422     replica->ProcessReplica();
00423     return replica;
00424 }
00425 
00426 void BL_ArmatureObject::ProcessReplica()
00427 {
00428     bPose *pose= m_pose;
00429     KX_GameObject::ProcessReplica();
00430 
00431     m_pose = NULL;
00432     m_framePose = NULL;
00433     game_copy_pose(&m_pose, pose, 1);   
00434 }

00436 void BL_ArmatureObject::ReParentLogic()
00437 {
00438     SG_DList::iterator<BL_ArmatureConstraint> cit(m_controlledConstraints);
00439     for (cit.begin(); !cit.end(); ++cit) {
00440         (*cit)->ReParent(this);
00441     }
00442     KX_GameObject::ReParentLogic();
00443 }

00445 void BL_ArmatureObject::Relink(CTR_Map<CTR_HashedPtr, void*> *obj_map)
00446 {
00447     SG_DList::iterator<BL_ArmatureConstraint> cit(m_controlledConstraints);
00448     for (cit.begin(); !cit.end(); ++cit) {
00449         (*cit)->Relink(obj_map);
00450     }
00451     KX_GameObject::Relink(obj_map);
00452 }
00453 
00454 bool BL_ArmatureObject::UnlinkObject(SCA_IObject* clientobj)
00455 {
00456     // clientobj is being deleted, make sure we don't hold any reference to it
00457     bool res = false;
00458     SG_DList::iterator<BL_ArmatureConstraint> cit(m_controlledConstraints);
00459     for (cit.begin(); !cit.end(); ++cit) {
00460         res |= (*cit)->UnlinkObject(clientobj);
00461     }
00462     return res;
00463 }
00464 
00465 void BL_ArmatureObject::ApplyPose()
00466 {
00467     m_armpose = m_objArma->pose;
00468     m_objArma->pose = m_pose;
00469     // in the GE, we use ctime to store the timestep
00470     m_pose->ctime = (float)m_timestep;
00471     //m_scene->r.cfra++;
00472     if (m_lastapplyframe != m_lastframe) {
00473         // update the constraint if any, first put them all off so that only the active ones will be updated
00474         SG_DList::iterator<BL_ArmatureConstraint> cit(m_controlledConstraints);
00475         for (cit.begin(); !cit.end(); ++cit) {
00476             (*cit)->UpdateTarget();
00477         }
00478         // update ourself
00479         UpdateBlenderObjectMatrix(m_objArma);
00480         where_is_pose(m_scene, m_objArma); // XXX
00481         // restore ourself
00482         memcpy(m_objArma->obmat, m_obmat, sizeof(m_obmat));
00483         // restore active targets
00484         for (cit.begin(); !cit.end(); ++cit) {
00485             (*cit)->RestoreTarget();
00486         }
00487         m_lastapplyframe = m_lastframe;
00488     }
00489 }
00490 
00491 void BL_ArmatureObject::RestorePose()
00492 {
00493     m_objArma->pose = m_armpose;
00494     m_armpose = NULL;
00495 }
00496 
00497 void BL_ArmatureObject::SetPose(bPose *pose)
00498 {
00499     extract_pose_from_pose(m_pose, pose);
00500     m_lastapplyframe = -1.0;
00501 }
00502 
00503 bool BL_ArmatureObject::SetActiveAction(BL_ActionActuator *act, short priority, double curtime)
00504 {
00505     if (curtime != m_lastframe) {
00506         m_activePriority = 9999;
00507         // compute the timestep for the underlying IK algorithm
00508         m_timestep = curtime-m_lastframe;
00509         m_lastframe= curtime;
00510         m_activeAct = NULL;
00511         // remember the pose at the start of the frame
00512         GetPose(&m_framePose);
00513     }
00514 
00515     if (act) 
00516     {
00517         if (priority<=m_activePriority)
00518         {
00519             if (priority<m_activePriority) {
00520                 // this action overwrites the previous ones, start from initial pose to cancel their effects
00521                 SetPose(m_framePose);
00522                 if (m_activeAct && (m_activeAct!=act))
00523                     /* Reset the blend timer since this new action cancels the old one */
00524                     m_activeAct->SetBlendTime(0.0); 
00525             }
00526             m_activeAct = act;
00527             m_activePriority = priority;
00528             m_lastframe = curtime;
00529         
00530             return true;
00531         }
00532         else{
00533             act->SetBlendTime(0.0);
00534             return false;
00535         }
00536     }
00537     return false;
00538 }
00539 
00540 BL_ActionActuator * BL_ArmatureObject::GetActiveAction()
00541 {
00542     return m_activeAct;
00543 }
00544 
00545 void BL_ArmatureObject::GetPose(bPose **pose)
00546 {
00547     /* If the caller supplies a null pose, create a new one. */
00548     /* Otherwise, copy the armature's pose channels into the caller-supplied pose */
00549         
00550     if (!*pose) {
00551         /* probably not to good of an idea to
00552          * duplicate everything, but it clears up 
00553          * a crash and memory leakage when 
00554          * &BL_ActionActuator::m_pose is freed
00555          */
00556         game_copy_pose(pose, m_pose, 0);
00557     }
00558     else {
00559         if (*pose == m_pose)
00560             // no need to copy if the pointers are the same
00561             return;
00562 
00563         extract_pose_from_pose(*pose, m_pose);
00564     }
00565 }
00566 
00567 void BL_ArmatureObject::GetMRDPose(bPose **pose)
00568 {
00569     /* If the caller supplies a null pose, create a new one. */
00570     /* Otherwise, copy the armature's pose channels into the caller-supplied pose */
00571 
00572     if (!*pose)
00573         game_copy_pose(pose, m_pose, 0);
00574     else
00575         extract_pose_from_pose(*pose, m_pose);
00576 }

00579 {
00580     return m_activePriority;
00581 }

00583 double BL_ArmatureObject::GetLastFrame()
00584 {
00585     return m_lastframe;

00587 
00588 bool BL_ArmatureObject::GetBoneMatrix(Bone* bone, MT_Matrix4x4& matrix)
00589 {
00590     bPoseChannel *pchan;
00591 
00592     ApplyPose();
00593     pchan = get_pose_channel(m_objArma->pose, bone->name);
00594     if (pchan)
00595         matrix.setValue(&pchan->pose_mat[0][0]);
00596     RestorePose();
00597 
00598     return (pchan != NULL);
00599 }
00600 
00601 float BL_ArmatureObject::GetBoneLength(Bone* bone) const
00602 {
00603     return (float)(MT_Point3(bone->head) - MT_Point3(bone->tail)).length();
00604 }

00663 KX_PYMETHODDEF_DOC_NOARGS(BL_ArmatureObject, update, 
00664                           "update()\n"
00665                           "Make sure that the armature will be updated on next graphic frame.\n"
00666                           "This is automatically done if a KX_ArmatureActuator with mode run is active\n"
